reviewText: Having lived during the time, this film is very interesting.  The use of combat film really shows the time frame of this film.  Technology has made combat films such as top gun as realistic as you can get.  This film is a great starting point.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Day to day combat and non-combat carrier operations are depicted well, giving the viewer a type of experience that many combat movies do not.  Stereotypes that flawed many movies of that era were thankfully minimal.  One won't get a feeling of a carrier group or task force from this movie, but on the individual level, this film shows what carrier life was, without the typical over-emphasis on pilots.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This film is one of the few in which all of the war footage and modern footage is in color.  The color is not quite true in the beginning, so the film may have suffered a bit in storage, or was not color corrected when transferred.  Still, modern audiences can see how some things actually looked.Korean era shots show F9F Panthers landing.  Late model F4U-4 Corsairs are used by the squadron in flashback.  Other footage include F6F, SBD, SB2C and TBF, with one postwar AD near crash subbing for a Corsair hot shot pilot that gets grounded.  Jap pilots are shown sitting in F6F cockpits!

reviewText: Two major ham actors and most of the action scenes didn't even include the planes they were flying.  The action scenes were real and actually depicted what went on out there.  Too bad they couldn't have found some key actors who could really act.  As it was, they only had to go a little further to make a comedy out of it.

reviewText: This was not a bad movie and it portrays WWII aircraft carriers decently but the information is woefully out of date and I don't think I saw anything in this movie that was even remotely current.  Still I enjoyed it strictly as entertainment.

reviewText: This movie I enjoyed because it is realistic in portraying conditions of flight combat. It's about a seasoned flight commander whose job is to train a squadron of fighter pilots on a flat top to work as a single unit. Naturally the pilots dislike him at first but after a few missions they realized his intentions. The movie leaves nothing to the imagination.
summary: How I wished there were more movies like this

reviewText: The flight deck operations scenes are interesting and some of the acting is good.  The main problem I have with this film is it gets the flying scenes wrong.  The US pilots hit everything they aim at and the enemy pilots can't hit the side of a barn.  The pilots are way to relaxed and unconcerned as they fly in battle.  They are supposedly flying corsairs but many of the battle camera scenes show various other WWII navy aircraft instead.  This film reminds me of a military public relations films to bolster the home front.

reviewText: i thought I had seen every WWII move ever made.  I keep finding jewels like this one on Amazon. This movie is a pretty good representation of what it must have been like to be a pilot on a WWII Aircraft Carrier, and what it must have been like to lead a group of men who just a few months before had been carefree civilians.  If you ilke old WWII movies this one will not disappoint.  I rated it five stars.  I would have given more if it were possible.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Of course career naval and retired naval personnel will say it does not show the boredom of day to day life aboard an Aircraft Carrier. But it does show vividly the comradship between crewmembers. And the love for their ship. You don't find that outside the military. Well rarely do you find it.
summary: Real life aboard an Aircraft Carrier in War

reviewText: I am so glad I rented this Marianas Turkey instead of buying it.Sterling Hayden leads a squadron of amazing Navy fliers whose planes magically change from F4Us to F6Fs and back again in a single mission.Apparently, this was our secret weapon to defeat Japanese Transformer squadrons which could change from Zeros into giant Kawanishi flying boats.Sterling Hayden later led his amazing Transformers squadron to victory over Godzilla and then had a smoke with Raymond Burr.The editor of this turkey should be taken out and keelhauled.Famous quote: "The smoking lamp is lit" - Sterling Hayden

reviewText: I forgot that I had seen this movie 25 years ago and a few years after I retired from the Air Force.  The Captain of the carrier was not a hard nosed SOB at all but doing what is normal as a military commander.  The hot shot pilot who ignored a wave off and almost wrecked an aircraft deserved to be grounded so why the big fuss from the Exec and the other pilots.  The movie was Hollywood's attempt at portraying reality.  Big name stars couldn't save it.  t fell flat as far as I was concerned and I couldn't watch the whole thing.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I enjoyed this movie. I agree with a lot of what the other reviewers said. Some of it was pretty dated and the acting wasn't great but it was a good old school war movie. Also I noticed while watching that the planes seemed to change in the live action footage but it was ok cause the real life combat footage was so real and so intense that it could only add to the movie.This may not be for everybody but for old school movie fans and war movie fans from the good old days, I think you will like it.

reviewText: I joined the U.S. NAVAL RESERVE in july 1965....right after high school...to AVOID the DRAFT at the time to be sent over-seas to the VIETNAM WAR...My first enlistment was called 2x6....2 years ACTIVE DUTY AND 6 YEARS SERVICE....PLUS I also reenlisted for another 4(four) years...haveing a military service of ten years federal service....I, unfortunately, had one regret....that was NOT RE-ENLISTING full time ACTIVE DUTY and eventually retiring from the NAVY after twenty years or more....
